content:
I am a PhD student in the Tangram (previously Magrit) team at Inria in Nancy. I am supervised by Marie-Odile Berger and Gilles Simon. My general areas of interest are computer vision, machine learning and augmented reality. My research focuses on visual localization.
Before starting my PhD, I have worked for 2 years at Kitware, as a computer vision engineer. I wrote my Master Thesis at SICK IVP, supervised by Ola Friman, on Super-resolution for Time-of-flight Cameras. I received a French Engineering degree from the UTC and a MSc from Linköping University, Sweden, both in Computer Science. I have also spent 6 months as an exchange student at Technische Universität Chemnitz in Germany.
summary: I am a PhD student in the Tangram (previously Magrit) team at Inria in Nancy. I am supervised by Marie-Odile Berger and Gilles Simon. My general areas of interest are computer vision, machine learning and augmented reality.
title: Matthieu Zins

summary:
TopCoder Marathon Match / Data Science
2nd Place The US National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency (NGA) was seeking novel approaches for satellite imagery segmentation in order to detect, delineate, and describe circular shaped features. My final solution reached 92% on their secret dataset. NGA's announcement (PyTorch, OpenCV, GDAL)
title: Circle Finder

summary:
3DV 2020(oral)
3D coherent ellipses prediction to improve object-based localization.
title: 3D-Aware Ellipse Prediction for Object-Based Camera Pose Estimation

summary:
TopCoder Marathon Match / Data Science
3nd Place The goal of this challenge was automatic detection and segmentation of faults (curved surfaces) in 3D seismic data. (C++, PCL, eigen, Docker)
title: Fault Detection in a 3D Seismic Volume

summary:
TopCoder Development
1st Place The goal of this challenge was to fix the client's codebase and optimize its performance to be able to process very large datasets (several gigabytes of scan data).
title: Codebase Fixes and Performance Optimization

summary:
TopCoder Development
2nd Place The goal of this challenge was to develop a new functionality of conversion of 3D meshes into polylines sticks and integrate it in the client C++ codebase. (C++, eigen, libigl, PCL)
title: 3D-Mesh to Polyline Sticks Conversion

summary:
TopCoder Development
2nd Place The goal of this challenge was to implement calculation of various auxiliary data on the detected geological faults and integrate it in the client C++ codebase. (C++, eigen, libigl, PCL)
title: Calculation of Auxiliary Data for Geologic Fault Utilities

summary:
CVPR Workshop 2019
Automatic system for 3D building reconstruction for the IARPA CORE3D program. This works received the Best Paper Award.
title: Urban Semantic 3D Reconstruction From Multiview Satellite Imagery

summary:
Master Thesis
Evaluation of different super-resolution methods for time-of-flight cameras.
title: Color Fusion and Super-Resolution for Time-of-Flight Cameras

content: The goal of this challenge was to detect and segment faults (curved surfaces) from seismic volume data.
summary: The goal of this challenge was to detect and segment faults (curved surfaces) from seismic volume data.
title: Fault Detection in a 3D Seismic Volume (3rd place)
